When you hear it, come at once and follow me to the trysting place. Then, as the sun had already gone down in a blaze of red and gold, and the lengthening, he turned and led his flock away toward the sheepfolds.

Much-Afraid turned her face homeward, her heart full of happiness and excitement, and still feeling as though she would never be frightened again.

Much-Afraid turned her face homeward, her heart full of happiness and excitement, and still feeling as though she would never be frightened again. As she started back across the fields she sang to herself one of the songs from an old book of songs which the Shepherds often used.

Then, as the sun had already gone down in a blaze of red and gold, and the lengthening, he turned and led his flock away toward the sheepfolds. Much-Afraid turned her face homeward, her heart full of happiness and excitement, and still feeling as though she would never be frightened again. As she started back across the fields she sang to herself one of the songs from an old book of songs which the Shepherds often used. Never before had it seemed to her so sweet, so applicable.
You should now understand that after the athlete has placed the foot on the ground and decelerated flexion, all the lower-extremity muscles again act as a unit to initiate extension at the ankle, knee, and hip.
You should now understand that after the athlete has placed the foot on the ground and decelerated flexion, all the lower-extremity muscles again act as a unit to initiate extension at the ankle, knee, and hip. In fact, the quadriceps is not just extending the knee but assisting with plantar flexion of the ankle and extension of the hip.
You should now understand that after the athlete has placed the foot on the ground and decelerated flexion, all the lower-extremity muscles again act as a unit to initiate extension at the ankle, knee, and hip. In fact, the quadriceps is not just extending the knee but assisting with plantar flexion of the ankle and extension of the hip. When viewed through the functional anatomy lens, all the muscles act eccentrically in the first sequence to stop a movement and then milliseconds later act concentrically to create a movement.
You should now understand that after the athlete has placed the foot on the ground and decelerated flexion, all the lower-extremity muscles again act as a unit to initiate extension at the ankle, knee, and hip. When viewed through the functional anatomy lens, all the muscles act eccentrically in the first sequence to stop a movement and then milliseconds later act concentrically to create a movement. If these concepts begin to make sense, you are on your way to understanding the science of functional anatomy and the concept of functional training.

When an athlete performs a nonfunctional exercise such as a leg extension, she is using a muscle action and nervous system pattern that is never employed when walking or running.

When an athlete performs a nonfunctional exercise such as a leg extension, she is using a muscle action and nervous system pattern that is never employed when walking or running. The athlete is by definition performing an open-chain muscle action. Open-chain means the foot is not in contact with the ground (or a stable platform).

When an athlete performs a nonfunctional exercise such as a leg extension, she is using a muscle action and nervous system pattern that is never employed when walking or running. The athlete is by definition performing an open-chain muscle action. Open-chain means the foot is not in contact with the ground (or a stable platform). To exercise a muscle as it will be used, you need to close the chain and allow the muscles to work as they would when the foot is on the ground.

When an athlete performs a nonfunctional exercise such as a leg extension, she is using a muscle action and nervous system pattern that is never employed when walking or running. The athlete is by definition performing an open-chain muscle action. Open-chain means the foot is not in contact with the ground (or a stable platform). To exercise a muscle as it will be used, you need to close the chain and allow the muscles to work as they would when the foot is on the ground. In regard to the lower extremity, open-chain or single-joint can be considered almost synonymous with nonfunctional.
